text: The Jam was an English rock band formed in Woking, Surrey in 1972. The members were Paul Weller (guitar, vocals), Bruce Foxton (bass guitar, vocals), and Rick Buckler (drums). Having come out of from the short Punk movement they went on to become one of the UK's top bands. They had four number one hits which were Going Underground, Start!, Town Called Malice and Beat Surrender. The Jam disbanded in 1982. Lead singer Paul Weller went on to have hits with The Style Council during the remainder of the 1980s. During the 1990s he had a successful solo career. ==References== Category:1972 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:1982 disestablishments in Europe Category:1970s British music groups Category:1980s British music groups Category:English punk bands Category:English rock bands Category:Musical groups disestablished in 1982 Category:Musical groups established in 1972 Category:New wave bands Category:Organisations based in Surrey Category:1980s disestablishments in the United Kingdom
title: The Jam
